solution.text:
\((4a+13y)^2-5(4a+13y)+6\)
Let \(x=4a+13y\)
\(=x^2-5x+6\)
Notice that \(x^2-5x+6\,\) can be written as \(x^2+(-2-3)x+(-2)(-3)\)
Using identity \(x^2+(a+b)x+ab=(x+a)(x+b)\)
\(=(x-2)(x-3)\)
Now substitute \(x\,\) for \(4a+13y\)
\(=(4a+13y-2)(4a+13y-3)\)

hint.text:
Remember that some algebraic expressions can be factorized using identities. These are some common identities :
\(a^2+2ab+b^2=(a+b)^2\)
\(a^2-2ab+b^2=(a-b)^2\)
\(a^2-b^2=(a+b)(a-b)\)

Try and use the method completing the perfect square
For example :
\(a^2+8a+15\)
\(=a^2+8a+4^2-4^2+15\,\)[Adding and subtracting \(4^2\)]
\(=a^2+(2)(a)(4)+4^2-1\)
\(=(a+4)^2-1\)
Now use the identity \(a^2-b^2=(a-b)(a+b)\)
\(=(a+4-1)(a+4+1)\)
\(=(a+3)(a+5)\)

Try and use the method completing the perfect square
For example :

\(=a^2+(2)(a)(4)+4^2-1\)

Now use the identity \(a^2-b^2=(a-b)(a+b)\)
\(=(a+4-1)(a+4+1)\)
\(=(a+3)(a+5)\)

Remember that \((x+a)(x+b)=x^2+(a+b)x+ab\)
For example:
\(x^2+13x+36\,\)can be written as \(x^2+(9+4)x+(9)(4)\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2+13x+36=(x+9)(x+4)\)

solution.text:
\(x^2+11x+18\)
Notice that \(x^2+11x+18\,\)can be written as \(x^2+(2+9)x+(2)(9)\,\)
Using identity : \(x^2+(a+b)x+ab=(x+a)(x+b)\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2+(2+9)x+(2)(9)=(x+2)(x+9)\)

hint.text:

For example:
\(x^2+13x+36\,\)can be written as \(x^2+(9+4)x+(9)(4)\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2+13x+36=(x+9)(x+4)\)

solution.text:
\(y^2+14y+33\)
Notice that \(y^2+14y+33\,\)can be written as \(y^2+(3+11)y+(3)(11)\,\)
Using identity : \(x^2+(a+b)x+ab=(x+a)(x+b)\)
\(\Rightarrow y^2+(3+11)y+(3)(11)=(y+3)(y+11)\)

\(\Rightarrow x^2+13x+36=(x+9)(x+4)\)

solution.text:
\(t^2+2t-24\)
Notice that \(t^2+2t-24\,\)can be written as \(t^2+(6-4)t+6(-4)\,\)
Using identity : \(x^2+(a+b)x+ab=(x+a)(x+b)\)
\(\Rightarrow t^2+(6-4)t+6(-4)=(t+6)(t-4)\)

solution.text:
\(s^2-2s-99\)
Notice that \(s^2-2s-99\,\)can be written as \(s^2+(9-11)s+9(-11)\,\)
Using identity : \(x^2+(a+b)x+ab=(x+a)(x+b)\)
\(\Rightarrow s^2+(9-11)s+9(-11)=(s+9)(s-11)\)
